result.execSummary:
The defendant Heather A Yohn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Outstanding financial obligations are not a condition of probation & are to be paid directly to the Shawano Co Clerk of Court office within 30 days.  Debts older than 60 days will be processed for tax intercept & civil judgments.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Payment plans available for qualifying amounts.
All financials same as noted above.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Heather A Yohn

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Heather A Yohn in court.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Right to counsel given - defendant proceeds w/o counsel.  Court accepts waiver of attorney for now.  Defendant enters a plea of no contest.  Court advises party of their rights, finds factual basis, accepts defendant's waiver of their rights, the plea made, and finds guilty.  Remarks by Atty. Niemi and the defendant.  Court makes its findings and pronounces sentence.

Defendant Heather A Yohn not in court.  Catharine Denise White appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called at 8:54 am. DE does not call in.  ADA White requests $500 cash or body warrant to be signed @4:00 PM today. Court authorizes warrant as requested.

Defendant Heather A Yohn in court by phone.  Catharine Denise White appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court explains attorney rights to DE.  DE waives attorney. Court accepts waiver.  ADA White - State is prepared for trial, Witness list is filed.  Court questions DE re: trial prep, pre-trial motions and witnesses.  ADA White - DE has not asked for discovery.  DE states new address, changes mind and now wants attorney.  Court cancels current JT date, reminds DE of bond conditions.  Status conference scheduled for September 1, 2015 at 03:45 pm.
No contact with North Star Casino.

Defendant Heather A Yohn in court.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Right to counsel given - defendant proceeds w/o counsel.  Court accepts waiver of attorney for now.  Defendant enters a plea of not guilty.  DA recommends $150 fine + costs and DNA surcahrge.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 19, 2015 at 04:00 pm.
